display_asset.caption: A rally organized by Women's Voices for the Earth outside Procter & Gamble's corporate headquarters.

summaries.body: Increased pressure by activists has led Procter & Gamble and rival Kimberly-Clark to begin posting online the ingredients in their feminine hygiene products.

display_asset.caption: Sheikh Salman bin Ebrahim al-Khalifa, president of the Asian Football Confederation, at a meeting in Bahrain’s capital, Manama, in April.

summaries.body: Activists expressed anger at the possibility that a member of Bahrain’s royal family could be the next head of FIFA, citing the monarchy’s crackdown on pro-democracy protests.

display_asset.caption: Cui Xing, left, and Wu Tun, both members of Ai Weiwei's studio, placing final pieces into portraits of political exiles and prisoners of conscience made of Lego bricks on Alcatraz in San Francisco Bay, on Sept. 10, 2014
display_asset.credit: Thor Swift for The New York Times

summaries.body: The Danish maker of Legos, the iconic toy bricks, was criticized after the Chinese artist and dissident Ai Weiwei said the company rejected an order for two installations.
An international show jumper was found slaughtered on a farm in Florida over the weekend. The authorities are investigating whether the horse was butchered for its meat.

display_asset.caption: Ben Carson spoke outside a fraternity house at Iowa State University in Ames, Iowa, on Saturday.

summaries.body: Ben Carson has opened a double-digit lead over Donald J. Trump in Iowa, according to a poll that reinforces evidence the crucial caucus state is getting away from the developer.

display_asset.credit: Andy McMillan for the New York Times

summaries.body: Eating processed meat can raise the risk in humans of getting colon cancer, and there is also limited evidence that red meat may cause some cancers, a W.H.O. report said.

display_asset.caption: Men playing checkers in Beijing. By 2020, China will have an estimated 30 million bachelors.

summaries.body: Not enough women in China? An economist proposed that one solution to China’s huge surplus of single men could be to allow men to share a wife.

display_asset.caption: The monument as it looks today.

summaries.body: A Ukrainian artist transformed a statue of Vladimir Lenin into Darth Vader in response to recent laws requiring the removal of Communist symbols in Ukraine.

posts.footer: William D. Lese, a managing partner at Braemar Energy Ventures, said of the venture capital flowing into the field of fusion power, via The New York Times

summaries.body: The fusion era is here and coming.

display_asset.caption: President Xi Jinping, center, and other Communist Party leaders voting during the Third Plenum of the 18th Central Committee in 2013. The Fifth Plenum takes place next week.

summaries.body: China's Central Committee of the Communist Party will gather Monday in a heavily guarded hotel in Beijing for a four-day meeting.

display_asset.caption: Steve Simon with Maria Sharapova on Sunday at the WTA Finals in Singapore. At right, the chair umpire Eva Asderaki.

summaries.body: As the new leader of the Women’s Tennis Association, Steve Simon faces concerns about finding a lead sponsor for the tour and about the grueling nature of its schedule.

display_asset.caption: “Cobb’s Barns, South Truro,” top, and “Burly Cobb’s House, South Truro,” in the Oval Office. The works are by Edward Hopper.

summaries.body: Works by Mark Rothko, Robert Rauschenberg and others are currently featured at the White House, among the 19th-century landscapes and portraits of past presidents.
BREAKING: Canadian authorities: At least 3 dead after whale watching boat sinks off British Columbia.
People with very low incomes are not usually required to file a tax return, but must do so to keep tax credits for premiums provided under the Affordable Care Act.

display_asset.caption: Jared Fogle, the former Subway spokesman, is scheduled to be sentenced on Nov. 19 after pleading guilty to sex acts with minors and distribution of child pornography.

summaries.body: Jared Fogle, the former Subway sandwich pitchman who pleaded guilty to sex with minors and distribution of child pornography, has started paying $1.4 million to victims.

display_asset.credit: Neil Mockford/Alex Huckle/GC Images, via Getty

summaries.body: Sepia-toned tears, rain, wind-swept hair and high notes — Adele is back. She released “Hello,” her first song in three years, with a video by the Canadian director Xavier Dolan.

display_asset.caption: Asia Thompson, a student at Misericordia University in Dallas, Pa., and a mother of two, said she hoped the screening by doctors would help.
display_asset.credit: Brett Carlsen for The New York Times

summaries.body: The American Academy of Pediatrics urged pediatricians to screen patients for food insecurity and to refer parents to appropriate agencies so children do not go hungry.

display_asset.caption: Rod Stewart's breakout hit came in 1971.

summaries.body: With Paul McCartney, Mick Jagger and other rock stars of their era still performing and recording as septuagenarians, it should not be a surprise Rod Stewart has a new album.

display_asset.caption: Andy Kaufman, the real one, in 1974.

summaries.body: The comedians Andy Kaufman and Redd Foxx are going to tour, years after their deaths.

display_asset.caption: Drilling rigs at an oil well in Monagas State run by Petróleos de Venezuela,  the government-owned oil company, which has come under scrutiny in bribery and money-laundering inquiries.

summaries.body: U.S. investigators are increasingly focusing on Venezuelan officials suspected of corruption, including officials at the government-owned oil company, Petróleos de Venezuela.
President Obama defended the Black Lives Matter movement, saying the group raised legitimate concerns about the treatment of African-Americans by the police.

display_asset.caption: A jade dealer used a flashlight to inspect the quality of stones at a market in Mandalay, Myanmar, in July 2014.
display_asset.credit: Adam Dean for The New York Times

summaries.body: Myanmar’s jade trade, a secretive industry driving armed conflict and rampant drug abuse, was worth as much as $31 billion in 2014, according to a new report.
Tyrone Howard, who is accused of fatally shooting a police officer in East Harlem this week, faces up to 12 years in prison for violating his plea deal in a drug case.

display_asset.caption: For the first time since being charged with murder, Charles Lai, center, and Kenny Kwan, right, appeared before Judge Richard S. Claypool of Magisterial District Court in Pocono Pines, Pa.
display_asset.credit: Bryan Anselm for The New York Times

summaries.body: Five fraternity members from New York City appeared before a judge for the first time since being charged with murder in the 2013 death of a pledge in a hazing ritual.

display_asset.caption: An official with the local sheriff’s department took a sample from the Animas River in August after a spill of three million gallons of toxic wastewater.
display_asset.credit: Jerry Mcbride/The Durango Herald, via Associated Press

summaries.body: The E.P.A., which accidentally spilled three million gallons of toxic wastewater in Colorado, lacks the technical skills to handle such tricky projects, a government study said.

display_asset.caption: Empty coal gondolas in a rail yard in Danville, W.Va. Patrick Morrisey, West Virginia's attorney general, said President Obama's climate change regulations would have "devastating impacts" on families in his state.
display_asset.credit: Luke Sharrett for The New York Times

summaries.body: As many as 25 states will join influential business groups in legal action to block President Obama’s climate change regulations when they are published Friday.
Pandora, the Web radio service, took a step toward détente with the major record labels when it said it had reached a $90 million settlement over royalties for older songs.
The police in Bavaria picked up 13 people and seized a cache of weapons, in raids that may have disrupted a suspected plot by extremists to attack refugees.
Some people were upset that ads for “underwear for women with periods” might be kept from New York's subways. But the ads will be approved, a spokesman said.

display_asset.caption: People attended a rally on Thursday in West Palm Beach, Fla., for Corey Jones, who was shot and killed by a plainclothes police officer on Sunday.

summaries.body: Lawyers and the family of Corey Jones, a Florida drummer who was shot by a plainclothes police officer on Sunday, offered some of the first details of the fatal encounter.
